page.title: 09Interesting facts on Rubery.
page.content: { 1 Cardinal Newman's}grave is at the {Oratory Retreat}in Leech Green Lane . 2 "Buffalo Bill" & 4 Red Indians once stayed at the New Rose and Crown. 3. Gannow Manor, an ancient monument was occupied between 1250 and 1500. This manor was once part of the estate of Margaret, wife of Thomas Boleyn, whose daughter became Queen Anne Boleyn. 4. The original St. Chad's Church was modelled on a 15th. Century Gothic one. 5. Beacon Hill (987ft.) is the highest feature of the Lickey Hills. it gets it's name from the fact that beacons used to be lit in times of danger. 6.The Lickey Hills get their name from La Lecheye (1255) which indicates a forest enclosure.
